Segments: j + e h ɨ t ə
k + ɨ t ə g ɨ
k + e j e ɸ u
k ɨ + w + t o m
w + ə ʔ + e p ɨ
w ɨ + t ə m ɨ

Comment: Werikyana has long e in this verb, assuming the same pattern for Proto-Waiwaian allows reconciling the divergent Waiwai and Hixkaryána forms.
The length is unexpected if the form comes from *epɨ; meira1998proto argues that it comes from *əepɨ
wɨs-tə-ri. I interpret wɨs- as an allomorph of wɨhɨ ‘1’. /s/ becomes /h/ intervocalically in Mapoyo.
